character.deck: Serial killer from Buckaroo, Oregon. He lured his victims in by screaming for help. He later died from stab wounds from an unknown assailant.

character.deck: The Fable who supplied the original Barleycorn's that made Johnny Bullhorn so famed as they could grow women.
character.description: The former leader of the 13th floor who has gone a little crazy. It is hinted that Frau Totenkinder was the one who caused her to go mad after she took over the Fairy Witch's role - besides, when Totenkinder gave her knitting needles and her bag of wool balls their true forms and names back and stopped knitting, the Great Fairy Witch continued to knit with no needles and no wool. She has gone by other names including Ardelia, Cherish, Birdie and Bulah. Bill Willingham has stated she is the same witch seen in the Fables story, "The Barleycorn Brides" and is the witch from Thumbelina
character.name: The Good Witch

character.deck: Good Girl is the protagonist of C.H.I.X.
character.description: Good Girl is a super cute heroine, the main character in CHIX. She has all the usual powers of a heroine but mostly uses her superhuman strength (like bending metal with her bare hands).
character.name: Good Girl

concept.deck: A popular genre of comic book art, aimed primarily at male readers, that features attractive and often provocatively-dressed female characters in alluring poses. Good Girl Art in comics is understood to depict characters of the sweet or heroic variety, as opposed to Bad Girl Art, which features edgier and more violent female characters.
concept.description:
Overview

The term "good girl art" was first coined in the 1930's and at the time simply referred to published illustrations of attractively-drawn female characters, be they heroines, villainesses, or anything in between. Comparable terms include "pinup art" and "cheesecake art." In more specific comic book terms, Good Girl Art now refers to art featuring attractively-drawn female characters who are sweet or heroic in nature, i.e. "good girls." This narrower definition of Good Girl Art gained relevance after the term Bad Girl Art (referring to attractively-drawn female characters who are dark and violent in nature) was coined in the 1990's, resulting in the need for greater distinction between the two genres.

The good girl art concept first began at the onset of World War II, during the Golden Age of Comics. Servicemen sought out diversions from their duties on the battlefield and at sea by reading comic strips and books featuring women drawn in the "good girl" style. These women were portrayed in an attractive and visually appealing manner, and were often scantily-clad in bathing suits and bikinis, or in mildly suggestive attire such as tight dresses. One of the earliest masters of the art form was artist Matt Baker, who became famous for his sexy renditions of Phantom Lady and other female superheroes of the era.
concept.name: Good Girl Art

first_appeared_in_issue.name: Mawa y los feroces pigmeos de Tiw

location.deck: Training facilities for Darkseid's elite soldiers.
location.description: There are many orphanages in Apokolips and the largest is called the Happiness Home which also serves as Granny Goodness's homebase.
location.name: Granny Goodness' Orphanage

issue.description:
Good 'nuff

Issue 1 of an action packed sit-com-ic that takes a slide-ways swipe at societies fame fixated failings.

Welcome to Mega-Fornia where Su-Lebs (Super Celebrities) are worshiped and No-Po's (Non-Powered) are ignored.

Starring a wannabe and a never-was on their desperate quest to become rich and famous heroes in a world where crime is non existent.

In this issue our desperate duo are sent to a su-leb rehab centre by their psychic PR agent and snitch Richy in order to solve a dastardly crime. Namely who keeps stealing the patients wallets.

Good Guys is a black and white comic for anyone who has chased the dream long after everyone else has woke up. It's a nod to the naive hopeful and a wink to the washed-up waster.

Good Guys don't give up even when no one needs them.
issue.name: Good 'nuff

issue.description:
• MS. LONELYHEARTS
  • FACE THE FACTS OF LOVE
  • SHUTTER-BUGGED
issue.name: Good Girls

issue.description: Act three of SATELLITE SAM starts here with a bang—is someone at the LeMonde Network a killer? What happened to the girl who knows all the secrets? Will the dark secret that threatens the whole show come out in the gossip columns? The fabulous fifties were never so filthy.
issue.name: Good Morning, Good Morning

issue.description: With a new team in place, the Outsiders find themselves at odds with an entire nation, not to mention the super-hero community. Also, the Outsiders try to stop the Brotherhood of Evil in a plot that involves selling Metahumans to the underworld.
issue.name: Outsiders: The Good Fight

issue.description: Christmas cover and issue. Spotlighting Green Lantern, the Flash, Wildcat and Hawkman! The four original members of the Justice Society head to northern Maine on Christmas Eve to help a dear old friend and super-hero in his own right: Santa Claus! Or is it a long-lost former member that needs a little Christmas cheer?
issue.name: Be Good for Goodness Sake

person.aliases: The Duck Man The Good Duck Artist
person.deck: A legendary creator, best known for Donald Duck, Scrooge McDuck, and many of the other characters in Duckberg.
person.description:
He redefined their world, and them, and also created various, still important characters of his own.

In additon to being a wonderful artist, he was also a character inside comics.

Inducted into the first class of the Eisner Awards' Comic Hall of Fame in 1987.
person.name: Carl Barks

team.deck: The Good Monsters were formed by Vampire to fight against Warlock and his Evil Monsters.
team.description:
Vampire's allies, the Good Monsters have banded together to battle Warlock and the Evil Monsters.  After they are transformed into miniature monsters, they befriend Jack Miles who attempts to help restore them to their original size.  The Good Monsters consist of Vampire, The Monster, Werewolf, Vampiress, Mummy, Hobgoblin, Jotun Troll, Mad Scientist, Swamp Beast, The Phantom, and Golem.
 

Other Media:

 
  • The Good Monsters appear in the animated special "The Big Scream."  However, the number of monsters is cut down to four -- Dr. Davenport (Invisible Man), Big Ed (The Monster), Wolfmon (Werewolf), and Mummy.  They search for famous novelist Edgar Raven, but instead find his daughter, Carrie, who aids them against Vampire, who in the special is a member of the Evil Monsters.
  • The only Good Monsters who appear in "Monster in My Pocket: The Video Game" are Vampire and The Monster.  Hobgoblin appears as an enemy monster.

first_appeared_in_issue.name: The Convention of Terror / Small Problems

team.name: Good Monsters

team.deck: Seven member team of kids who gain superpowers at the Mile High Comics store when one of them jostles a Magic Box. Each Member takes on the abilities of whichever hero they had been thinking of at the time...some evil customers share the experience and are changed as well
team.description: The characters were designed after real people, there was contest in the first Defiant books to submit your ideas for the heroes and the winner got their character and their likeness drawn into the comic.
team.name: Good Guys

team.deck: Walking and talking trees on Living Island.
team.name: The Good Trees

team.deck: The Knights of Good is a group of players belonging to a massive online gaming community known as The Game in Dark Horse Comic Books' "The Guild".
team.description: The Knights of Good are a team featured in  "The Guild", the web show created by Felicia Day. The group consists of six people, each with different personalities, but with one thing in common, they are all addicted to a online video game.
team.name: The Knights of Good

team.deck: A Pigeon Gang That Parodies The Goodfellas
team.description:
Overview

Goodfeathers is a pigeon gang which is lead by Bobby and has 2 members: Pesto and Squit. Goodfeathers is an obvious parody to Goodfellas, a crime movie. Bobby is a parody of Jimmy the Gent, Squit is a parody of Henry and Pesto is a parody of Tommy. Bobby is shown to have leadership, while Pesto has an aggressive side which tends to get Squit always getting beat up by him. Squit is a nervous but optimistic pigeon. There is a boss, who is named The Godpigeon (a parody of Vito from the Godfather), a very old pigeon who seems to mumble gibberish every single time he talks, which only Bobby understands.

first_appeared_in_issue.name: 'Twas The Day Before Christmas; The Taming Of The Screwy

team.name: Goodfeathers

team.deck: Trio of British comedians whose long running and often surreal TV show also spawned a comic strip.
team.description:
Origin

The Goodies are a trio of troubleshooters for hire.

Creation

Comedians Tim Brooke-Taylor, Graeme Garden and Bill Oddie comprise the Goodies, who starred in a long-running sketch show / situation comedy that ran on BBC 1

In 1973 the Goodies were adapted into a comic strip that appeared in Cor!!.
team.name: The Goodies

team.deck: A New York law firm specializing in superhuman law. Their most well-known lawyer was formerly Jennifer Walters AKA the She-Hulk.
team.description:
Origin

A prestigious and esteemed New York law firm, Goodman, Lieber, Kurtzberg & Holliway offers legal aid and services to super powered individuals. They have often hired many super powered lawyers as well, including most notably She Hulk, Momenta, Two-Gun Kid, Southpaw and Awesome Andy. They have represented the likes of Starfox, Hercules, Grey Gargoyle, Spider-Man, Beast, Rage, and White Rabbit. Initially they were only open to representing superhero clients, but eventually opened their services to represent super villains as well.

Holden Holliway hired lawyer Jennifer Walters initially for her lawyer skills, and her ties to the superhero community as She Hulk, but also because he thought she could provide a positive influence on Southpaw. She-Hulk, however, is currently not involved with the law firm, focusing more on her superhero endeavors and her involvement with the Lady Liberators and the Fantastic Four.

Creation

The GLKH law firm was first created by Dan Slott and Adi Granov. The first three partners, Martin Goodman, Stanley Lieber and Jacob Kurtzberg are never seen. Each is named for one of the founders of Marvel: Martin Goodman was the first publisher of Marvel, and Lieber and Kurtzberg are the birth names of Stan Lee and Jack Kirby.
team.name: Goodman, Lieber, Kurtzberg & Holliway

episode.description: Lucifer and Chloe desperately search for an antidote to save her, learning from the Professor's associate that he sourced the ingredients for his poisons from an amateur artist. Chloe collapses and is hospitalized, while Dan and Lucifer learn that the formula for the antidote was known only to Carlisle. With no other options, Lucifer has Maze and Linda stop his heart, allowing him to enter Hell and find Carlisle's soul, which is now eternally tormented by an illusion of the driver's death. Lucifer tricks him into turning over the formula in return for absolution, which is subsequently denied. While waiting to be revived, however, Lucifer stumbles upon an illusion of Uriel, who forces Lucifer to kill him again and again. Charlotte sends herself to Hell to free him, but ends up succumbing to her own guilt, forcing Lucifer to drag her away. Upon being revived, Lucifer meets up with Dan and Ella, who have retrieved the ingredients, and creates the antidote. Charlotte tries to reconnect with her son, but he disowns her for deceiving him. When Chloe visits Lux later that night, she is shocked to find it closed for business, with Lucifer nowhere to be found.
episode.name: A Good Day to Die
